qas.question: After what political upheaval was gin introduced to England?
What people introduced gin to England?
In what year did the Glorious Revolution occur?
How much more gin than beer was made in England in 1740?
In 1740, what fraction of London drinking establishments were gin shops?

context: The 18th century saw a huge growth in the number of drinking establishments, primarily due to the introduction of gin. Gin was brought to England by <a1_0>the Dutch<a1_0/> after <a0_0>the Glorious Revolution<a0_0/> of <a2_0>1688<a2_0/> and became very popular after the government created a market for "cuckoo grain" or "cuckoo malt" that was unfit to be used in brewing and distilling by allowing unlicensed gin and beer production, while imposing a heavy duty on all imported spirits. As thousands of gin-shops sprang up all over England, brewers fought back by increasing the number of alehouses. By 1740 the production of gin had increased to <a3_0>six times<a3_0/> that of beer and because of its cheapness it became popular with the poor, leading to the so-called Gin Craze. Over <a4_0>half<a4_0/> of the 15,000 drinking establishments in London were gin shops.
